carousel_items: It can take several days for Fluticasone to start working fully.
Don't take more of it than was prescribed for you.
Blow your nose before using Fluticasone.
Can cause thrush (a fungal infection) inside the nose and throat.
Can also cause a headache, sore throat, or nosebleeds.

basics.benefits_moa: Fluticasone is a nasal steroid. It works directly in your nose to reduce swelling and inflammation caused by allergies.
basics.bottom_line: Fluticasone is a good first-choice medicine for treating a runny or stuffy nose caused by allergies, and it's cheaper than some alternatives.
downsides: Fluticasone doesn't have a counter on it, so it can be hard to remember how many sprays are left (each bottle has 120 sprays).
Needs to be primed (pressed/pumped until a fine spray appears) up to six times prior to using it for the first time, or if you haven't used it in 2 weeks.
Since the medicine in Fluticasone is a steroid, it can slow down your healing process if you've hurt your nose or had nose surgery.

downsides_processed.orig: Fluticasone doesn't have a counter on it, so it can be hard to remember how many sprays are left (each bottle has 120 sprays).
Needs to be primed (pressed/pumped until a fine spray appears) up to six times prior to using it for the first time, or if you haven't used it in 2 weeks.
Since the medicine in Fluticasone is a steroid, it can slow down your healing process if you've hurt your nose or had nose surgery.

upsides: First-choice medication for treating runny and stuffy noses caused by allergies. It works by reducing inflammation in the nose.
Because it's used directly where the inflammation is happening, it has fewer side effects than oral steroids do and has a lower chance of causing withdrawal symptoms once the medication is stopped.
Can be used as needed to help control symptoms in people age 13 years or older.
Available as a generic medication.

upsides_processed.orig: First-choice medication for treating runny and stuffy noses caused by allergies. It works by reducing inflammation in the nose.
Because it's used directly where the inflammation is happening, it has fewer side effects than oral steroids do and has a lower chance of causing withdrawal symptoms once the medication is stopped.
Can be used as needed to help control symptoms in people age 13 years or older.
Available as a generic medication.

userStories.tip: Has worked for me, reducing sinus infections from about four per year, to less than one. Seems to be most effective when used in conjunction with a nasal rinse. I do experience a side effect of reduced sensitivity to smell.

Always letting it expire and forgetting to use it, probably because I don't feel it working well right away. But when I actually use it regularly, for weeks, it does help with congestion. Use daily!!!

drugs.name: Flonase

carousel_items_processed.orig: It can take several days for Fluticasone to start working fully.
Don't take more of it than was prescribed for you.
Blow your nose before using Fluticasone.
Can cause thrush (a fungal infection) inside the nose and throat.
Can also cause a headache, sore throat, or nosebleeds.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression
risks_warnings.description: Switching from oral or injectable steroids to inhaled, especially if used for an extended amount of time, can cause withdrawal symptoms, including joint or muscle pain, lack of energy and depression. This can be worsened if you are under stress or if the change in steroid dose happens too quickly. Your doctor will work with you if this is a concern.
risk_factors: Switching from oral or injectable steroids to inhaled, especially if used long term
Using other inhaled steroids with Fluticasone

description_processed.orig: Switching from oral or injectable steroids to inhaled, especially if used for an extended amount of time, can cause withdrawal symptoms, including joint or muscle pain, lack of energy and depression. This can be worsened if you are under stress or if the change in steroid dose happens too quickly. Your doctor will work with you if this is a concern.

risks_warnings.title: Allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: People on this medication have reported wheezing, or nose and eye problems immediately taking after this medication. However, these reports are rare. If you notice problems breathing, pain in your nose, or changes in your vision, let your doctor know as soon as possible.

description_processed.orig: People on this medication have reported wheezing, or nose and eye problems immediately taking after this medication. However, these reports are rare. If you notice problems breathing, pain in your nose, or changes in your vision, let your doctor know as soon as possible.

risks_warnings.title: Decrease in growth in children and teenagers
risks_warnings.description: Children and teenagers who are on this medication for a long period of time can have slowed growth. The risk is greater if people use more than the prescribed amount. Talk to your doctor if this is a concern.

description_processed.orig: Children and teenagers who are on this medication for a long period of time can have slowed growth. The risk is greater if people use more than the prescribed amount. Talk to your doctor if this is a concern.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression
risks_warnings.description: Switching from oral or injectable steroids to inhaled, especially if used for an extended amount of time, can cause withdrawal symptoms, including joint or muscle pain, lack of energy and depression. This can be worsened if you are under stress or if the change in steroid dose happens too quickly. Your doctor will work with you if this is a concern.
risk_factors: Switching from oral or injectable steroids to inhaled, especially if used long term
Using other inhaled steroids with Fluticasone

description_processed.orig: Switching from oral or injectable steroids to inhaled, especially if used for an extended amount of time, can cause withdrawal symptoms, including joint or muscle pain, lack of energy and depression. This can be worsened if you are under stress or if the change in steroid dose happens too quickly. Your doctor will work with you if this is a concern.

risks_warnings.title: Thrush in the nose and throat
risks_warnings.description: Long-term use of Fluticasone can increase your chances of getting thrush in the nose and throat. Your doctor will check your nose and throat if you have to be on this medication for a long time. Also, tell your doctor if you notice pain in the nose and throat with redness and white patches.

description_processed.orig: Long-term use of Fluticasone can increase your chances of getting thrush in the nose and throat. Your doctor will check your nose and throat if you have to be on this medication for a long time. Also, tell your doctor if you notice pain in the nose and throat with redness and white patches.

risks_warnings.title: Reduced immune system
risks_warnings.description: Long-term use of Fluticasone may reduce your body's ability to fight infection, especially in the nose, throat and lungs. Tell your doctor if you've been exposed to tuberculosis or you need to be immunized.
risk_factors: Exposure to immunizable diseases (chickenpox and measles)

description_processed.orig: Long-term use of Fluticasone may reduce your body's ability to fight infection, especially in the nose, throat and lungs. Tell your doctor if you've been exposed to tuberculosis or you need to be immunized.

risks_warnings.title: Decreased wound healing
risks_warnings.description: If you've recently had surgery, ulcers, or trauma in your nose or sinuses, taking Fluticasone before your body has healed can reduce your body's ability to heal itself. Your doctor will make sure that you have healed adequately before starting or restarting Fluticasone.
risk_factors: Surgery or trauma to the nose or sinuses

description_processed.orig: If you've recently had surgery, ulcers, or trauma in your nose or sinuses, taking Fluticasone before your body has healed can reduce your body's ability to heal itself. Your doctor will make sure that you have healed adequately before starting or restarting Fluticasone.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in the nasal septum
risks_warnings.description: Long-term use of Fluticasone can increase your chances of having changes in the nasal septum (the bony cartilage between your nostrils). Your doctor will check your nose regularly if you have to be on this medication for a long time.

description_processed.orig: Long-term use of Fluticasone can increase your chances of having changes in the nasal septum (the bony cartilage between your nostrils). Your doctor will check your nose regularly if you have to be on this medication for a long time.

carousel_items: Use it every day to control your asthma symptoms.
Can take 2 weeks or more to feel full effects.
Pump the inhaler 4 times before your first dose, or if it's been more than 7 days since your last dose.
Wait at least 1 minute between doses.
Rinse your out mouth with water after each use.
Hold your breath for 10 seconds after using Advair Diskus.
Don't breathe out into the inhaler mouthpiece.
Tell your doctor if the medication stops working or if your symptoms get worse.
Diskus contains lactose, so don't use it if you're allergic to milk protein.

basics.benefits_moa: Fluticasone is a corticosteroid. It lowers inflammation in your lungs, which controls asthma and prevents asthma attacks.
basics.bottom_line: Fluticasone is good at controlling and preventing asthma symptoms when you take it every day.
downsides: You have to use Fluticasone every day to control your symptoms.
You can't lower the dose or stop taking it too suddenly.
Steroids can slow height growth in kids.
Because steroids suppress your immune system, you can catch bacterial and viral infections easier, and they can take longer to go away.
Can cause new or worsening eye pressure, glaucoma, and cataracts.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to use Fluticasone every day to control your symptoms.
You can't lower the dose or stop taking it too suddenly.
Steroids can slow height growth in kids.
Because steroids suppress your immune system, you can catch bacterial and viral infections easier, and they can take longer to go away.
Can cause new or worsening eye pressure, glaucoma, and cataracts.

upsides: Relieves symptoms and improves control of asthma.
People report fewer asthma symptoms and better lung function when they take it every day.

Inhaling this medicine (rather than taking an oral steroid) gets more into the lungs and less into rest of your body, which lowers the risk of side effects. Inhaled corticosteroids can be used safely for years compared to oral corticosteroids like prednisone.
Available as both an inhaler and Diskus device.

upsides_processed.orig: Relieves symptoms and improves control of asthma.
People report fewer asthma symptoms and better lung function when they take it every day.

Inhaling this medicine (rather than taking an oral steroid) gets more into the lungs and less into rest of your body, which lowers the risk of side effects. Inhaled corticosteroids can be used safely for years compared to oral corticosteroids like prednisone.
Available as both an inhaler and Diskus device.

userStories.tip: I should have been more aware of the risk of cataracts -- which I have developed in one eye, as a possible result of steroids in the bloodstream
I noticed 2 puffs is too strong for me and makes me completely sleepy, so I'm only using 1 of in the morning and it does stop the wheezing.

drugs.name: Flovent

carousel_items_processed.orig: Use it every day to control your asthma symptoms.
Can take 2 weeks or more to feel full effects.
Pump the inhaler 4 times before your first dose, or if it's been more than 7 days since your last dose.
Wait at least 1 minute between doses.
Rinse your out mouth with water after each use.
Hold your breath for 10 seconds after using Advair Diskus.
Don't breathe out into the inhaler mouthpiece.
Tell your doctor if the medication stops working or if your symptoms get worse.
Diskus contains lactose, so don't use it if you're allergic to milk protein.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression (HPA axis suppression)
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Fluticasone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your medication need to be done slowly and over time. Talk to your doctor before you decrease or stop Fluticasone.
risk_factors: Lowering dose or stopping too quickly especially after long-term treatment
Stress such as trauma, surgery or infection

description_processed.orig: Adrenal suppression can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Fluticasone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your medication need to be done slowly and over time. Talk to your doctor before you decrease or stop Fluticasone.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: Severe allergic reactions have been reported in people taking Fluticasone who have severe milk protein allergy. This reaction occurs with Fluticasone Diskus after inhaling the powder which contains lactose. Call 911 or your doctor right away if you develop severe rash, itching, swelling or difficulty breathing while taking Fluticasone. You should not use Fluticasone Diskus if you are tested or know about this allergy.

description_processed.orig: Severe allergic reactions have been reported in people taking Fluticasone who have severe milk protein allergy. This reaction occurs with Fluticasone Diskus after inhaling the powder which contains lactose. Call 911 or your doctor right away if you develop severe rash, itching, swelling or difficulty breathing while taking Fluticasone. You should not use Fluticasone Diskus if you are tested or know about this allergy.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk for bacterial and viral infection
risks_warnings.description: People who use drugs like Fluticasone for a long time may be at higher risk to catch bacterial and viral infections. It may take longer to fight these infections and they can be more serious. Talk to your doctor before taking Fluticasone if you have not had vaccinations against certain viral diseases.
risk_factors: Bacterial or viral infection not being treated
Not vaccinated against chickenpox or measles

description_processed.orig: People who use drugs like Fluticasone for a long time may be at higher risk to catch bacterial and viral infections. It may take longer to fight these infections and they can be more serious. Talk to your doctor before taking Fluticasone if you have not had vaccinations against certain viral diseases.

risks_warnings.title: Difficulty breathing (bronchospasm)
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of difficulty breathing (bronchospasm) after inhaling Fluticasone. Call 911 or your doctor right away if a fast-acting asthma inhaler does not stop the attack. Talk to you doctor if your asthma worsens while taking Fluticasone, you may need to discuss other medications that will treat your condition.

description_processed.orig: There are reports of difficulty breathing (bronchospasm) after inhaling Fluticasone. Call 911 or your doctor right away if a fast-acting asthma inhaler does not stop the attack. Talk to you doctor if your asthma worsens while taking Fluticasone, you may need to discuss other medications that will treat your condition.

risks_warnings.title: Reduced growth rate in children
risks_warnings.description: Inhaled steroid medications like Fluticasone can decrease growth rate in children. Your doctor will use the lowest possible dose to control asthma symptoms and will monitor height during while taking Fluticasone.

description_processed.orig: Inhaled steroid medications like Fluticasone can decrease growth rate in children. Your doctor will use the lowest possible dose to control asthma symptoms and will monitor height during while taking Fluticasone.

risks_warnings.title: Mouth and throat infection
risks_warnings.description: Fluticasone may cause a fungal infection of the mouth and throat called thrush. Tell your doctor if you notice white patches inside your mouth or throat or have difficulty swallowing while taking Fluticasone. Your doctor can prescribe medication to treat the infection.

description_processed.orig: Fluticasone may cause a fungal infection of the mouth and throat called thrush. Tell your doctor if you notice white patches inside your mouth or throat or have difficulty swallowing while taking Fluticasone. Your doctor can prescribe medication to treat the infection.

risks_warnings.title: Eye problems
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of new or worsening increased eye pressure, glaucoma and cataracts while taking Fluticasone. If you notice any changes in your vision, talk to your doctor.
risk_factors: History of high internal eye pressure

description_processed.orig: There are reports of new or worsening increased eye pressure, glaucoma and cataracts while taking Fluticasone. If you notice any changes in your vision, talk to your doctor.

carousel_items: Use daily to control your asthma symptoms.
Starts working the same day, but it can take up 1 to 2 weeks to feel the full effects.
Pump the inhaler 2 times before inhaling the first dose, or if it's been more than 10 days since your last dose.
Wait one minute between doses.
Rinse your mouth out with water after each use.
Clean the mouthpiece with dry cloth once a week.
Talk to your doctor if asthma symptoms don't get better.

Because steroids suppress your immune system, you can catch bacterial and viral infections easier, and they can take longer to go away.
Can cause new or worsening eye pressure, glaucoma, and cataracts.

userStories.tip: Forced to switch to Qvar when my insurance stopped covering Flovent. I had 3 asthma attacks after not having a single one for several years.
I wish that I had known it works by lowering the immune system since I already have a weak immune system problem.
Sore throat, swollen lymph nodes, headaches and worsened breathing.

carousel_items: Take it only once a day.
Starts working in a few hours.
Can make you feel sleepy, so take it at bedtime if needed.
Avoid possible side effects by drinking plenty of non-caffeinated liquids.
If you need to use it for more than a few weeks, talk with your doctor about trying a nasal steroid instead, which might work better for you long-term.
Using an antihistamine eye drop might work better to help itchy or watery eyes.

clock.tip: Works slower when taken with food.
Works slower when taken with food.

basics.benefits_moa: Claritin is an antihistamine. It blocks histamine, a chemical that causes congestion, itching, and other allergic reactions. Antihistamines can also make you sleepy, but Loratadine is a low-drowsiness version.
basics.bottom_line: Claritin is a once-daily allergy relief medication that doesn't make you feel sleepy.
downsides: For some people, its effectiveness on treating allergies wears off over time.
Some people find that other more sedating antihistamines (like Zyrtec or Benadryl) are more effective for them.
If you have daily allergy symptoms, a prescription nasal steroid spray might be better for you long-term.
Not for kids under 2 years.
The Reditabs version contains aspartame (phenylalanine).

downsides_processed.orig: For some people, its effectiveness on treating allergies wears off over time.
Some people find that other more sedating antihistamines (like Zyrtec or Benadryl) are more effective for them.
If you have daily allergy symptoms, a prescription nasal steroid spray might be better for you long-term.
Not for kids under 2 years.
The Reditabs version contains aspartame (phenylalanine).

upsides: Relieves allergy symptoms like sneezing and runny nose just as well as other antihistamines, but with less sedation (drowsiness).
Also treats hives and itchy skin.
Side effects are rare and usually mild.
Available over the counter without a prescription.
Comes as a tablet, liquid, or quick-dissolving tablet.
Can provide quick relief of allergy symptoms for both kids and adults.
Okay to take with most other medications because it doesn't have many interactions.

upsides_processed.orig: Relieves allergy symptoms like sneezing and runny nose just as well as other antihistamines, but with less sedation (drowsiness).
Also treats hives and itchy skin.
Side effects are rare and usually mild.
Available over the counter without a prescription.
Comes as a tablet, liquid, or quick-dissolving tablet.
Can provide quick relief of allergy symptoms for both kids and adults.
Okay to take with most other medications because it doesn't have many interactions.

userStories.tip: Doesn't work as well as Zyrtec for me.
taking when symptoms occur works great

drugs.name: Claritin

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take it only once a day.
Starts working in a few hours.
Can make you feel sleepy, so take it at bedtime if needed.
Avoid possible side effects by drinking plenty of non-caffeinated liquids.
If you need to use it for more than a few weeks, talk with your doctor about trying a nasal steroid instead, which might work better for you long-term.
Using an antihistamine eye drop might work better to help itchy or watery eyes.

risks_warnings.title: Taking the wrong medication
risks_warnings.description: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Claritin.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

description_processed.orig: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Claritin.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: People age 65 and older have a higher risk of troublesome side effects from taking antihistamine medications like Claritin.  Watch out for changes in vision, severe dry mouth, trouble urinating, or constipation. Also, feelings of drowsiness may leave you "unsteady" on your feet.  This can make you more likely to fall causing broken bones or other serious injuries. Talk with your doctor before using Claritin and stop using it if you have side effects.

description_processed.orig: People age 65 and older have a higher risk of troublesome side effects from taking antihistamine medications like Claritin.  Watch out for changes in vision, severe dry mouth, trouble urinating, or constipation. Also, feelings of drowsiness may leave you "unsteady" on your feet.  This can make you more likely to fall causing broken bones or other serious injuries. Talk with your doctor before using Claritin and stop using it if you have side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Claritin can lower your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Claritin can lower your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Brain damage from too much phenylalanine
risks_warnings.description: Claritin contains aspartame (phenylalanine). People who have phenylketonuria (PKU) can't break down the amino acid phenylalanine. It builds up and causes serious medical problems. If you have PKU, don't use this product.

description_processed.orig: Claritin contains aspartame (phenylalanine). People who have phenylketonuria (PKU) can't break down the amino acid phenylalanine. It builds up and causes serious medical problems. If you have PKU, don't use this product.

carousel_items: Starts working in 30 minutes.
Makes you urinate more often, so avoid taking it at bedtime.
Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness, fatigue, or muscle weakness that doesn't go away.
Requires routine blood tests to check kidney function.

basics.benefits_moa: Lasix is a loop diuretic (water pill). It works in the kidneys to make you urinate more, which removes extra water and certain electrolytes. This lowers blood pressure and swelling.
basics.bottom_line: Lasix is a very effective water pill and it'll certainly make you go to the bathroom more often.
downsides: Makes you urinate very frequently.
Can cause low levels of important electrolytes, such as potassium.

downsides_processed.orig: Makes you urinate very frequently.
Can cause low levels of important electrolytes, such as potassium.

upsides: A strong diuretic (water pill) that works well to get rid of extra fluids in your body through urination.
Lowers your blood pressure and your risk of heart attack and stroke.
Works better than thiazide diuretics (like Hydrochlorothiazide) at removing harmful levels of certain electrolytes, such as potassium.
Okay to take if you have kidney problems.

upsides_processed.orig: A strong diuretic (water pill) that works well to get rid of extra fluids in your body through urination.
Lowers your blood pressure and your risk of heart attack and stroke.
Works better than thiazide diuretics (like Hydrochlorothiazide) at removing harmful levels of certain electrolytes, such as potassium.
Okay to take if you have kidney problems.

drugs.one_liner: Lowers blood pressure. Removes extra water from your body.

userStories.tip: I take Mirtazapine  (Remeron ) for depression.  Caused major edema so started lasix and water weight slid right off. Doc switched to Spironolactone,  and my edema is back full force. 9 lbs in 24 hrs and so painful in legs =(
Usually lots of urination during first hours of taking.
Take Lasix 20mg in am, rehydrate early am thru afternoon, then taper off H2O thru eve/ night. Helps limit amount of times one wakes up to pee at night.

drugs.name: Lasix

carousel_items_processed.orig: Starts working in 30 minutes.
Makes you urinate more often, so avoid taking it at bedtime.
Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness, fatigue, or muscle weakness that doesn't go away.
Requires routine blood tests to check kidney function.

risks_warnings.title: Dehydration and electrolyte imbalance
risks_warnings.description: Too much Lasix can cause excessive urine production, which leads to dehydration and low levels of sodium, calcium, potassium or magnesium. The electrolyte imbalance can have negative affects on your muscles or other important organs. Any existing fluid or electrolyte imbalances should be addressed before using Lasix. Any changes for the medicine should be made by a doctor.

description_processed.orig: Too much Lasix can cause excessive urine production, which leads to dehydration and low levels of sodium, calcium, potassium or magnesium. The electrolyte imbalance can have negative affects on your muscles or other important organs. Any existing fluid or electrolyte imbalances should be addressed before using Lasix. Any changes for the medicine should be made by a doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Severe allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: There is a possibility that patients with allergies to other sulfa-containing medicines can experience similar sensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) with Lasix. Avoid use if prior reaction was severe. Discontinue use if hypersensitivity reactions are observed.

description_processed.orig: There is a possibility that patients with allergies to other sulfa-containing medicines can experience similar sensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) with Lasix. Avoid use if prior reaction was severe. Discontinue use if hypersensitivity reactions are observed.

risks_warnings.title: Hearing problems
risks_warnings.description: Lasix can cause ringing in the ears or trouble hearing. Use should be monitored by a healthcare provider especially if risk factors are present.
risk_factors: Other medicines that causes hearing problems
